resources.string: Classic Sudoku was created by Jeff Kennedy in early 2015 as a way to exercise his love of code and his love of Sudoku. If anyone else claims they made this, they are a liar and should be scorned as such.
Also, feel free to use, re-use, alter, or abuse this code to your heart\'s content. Just don\'t be a dick about it.

\"Sudoku\" is a Japanese word that essentially means \"Single Number.\" Originally it was a French game called \"Number Place\" that first appeared in Le Siecle in 1892, but it only lasted about a decade before fading into obscurity.
In the 1980\'s it was again popularized in Japan, with slightly different rules, under the name Sudoku and in the early 2000\'s grew into the worldwide phenomenon that it is today.
The goal of Sudoku is to fill every row, column, and 3x3 zone with the numbers 1 to 9. There can be no repetitions. Simple as that sounds, it can actually be quite challenging!
And with that out of the way, I wish you a Happy Sudokuing!
